law.text: A person taking an instrument, other than a person having rights of a holder in due course, is subject to a claim of a property or possessory right in the instrument or its proceeds, including a claim to rescind a negotiation and to recover the instrument or its proceeds. A person having rights of a holder in due course takes free of the claim to the instrument.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 32, effective January 1, 1997. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 3-306, effective July 1, 1960.
